meanings.sent1: The hungry dog was wolfing down its food.
meanings.sent2: She always wolfed down her dinner before going out to play.
meanings.sent3: The kids were wolfing their snacks like they hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent4: The tornado wolfed through the town, leaving nothing in its path.
meanings.sent5: The bear was wolfing the berries, not caring about anything else around.

meanings.definition: The act of devouring food quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: His wolfing of the pizza was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The wolfing at the buffet was impressive, but also a bit concerning.
meanings.sent3: The competition turned into a wolfing contest, with everyone trying to outeat each other.
meanings.sent4: The wolfing of the cake was so fast, it was gone before anyone could blink.
meanings.sent5: The bear's wolfing of the fish showed its true appetite.

meanings.definition: A person who eats quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the wolfing of the family, finishing her meals in record time.
meanings.sent2: The wolfing at the party was always the first one at the dessert table.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was a wolfing when it came to his favorite snacks.
meanings.sent4: He was a wolfing when it came to pizza, always asking for more.
meanings.sent5: The wolfing in the group could never resist a second helping.
